DOC.brief_title: Corneal Staining Physiological Compromise After Eight Hours Soft Contact Lens Wear
DOC.detailed_description: This investigation evaluate corneal stain epithelial barrier function eight hour contact lens wear , past peak staining time typical daily lens wear time . A silicone hydrogel lens multipurpose solution combination show induce significant corneal staining ( e.g . equivalent Grade 3 Grade 4 scale ) use evaluate potential corneal compromise . The study prospective , single-center , double-masked , contralateral , daily wear investigation adapt soft contact lens wearer . After three day washout period ( without lens wear , lenses worn one day eight hour . Corneal stain barrier function determine regimen saline control situation subject . Staining grade use Efron Grading Scale , permeability data estimate fluorescein penetration rate , Pdc nm/sec test control condition .
DOC.criteria: At least 18 year age . Understand right research subject give write informed consent signing Informed Consent Form , Subject Bill Rights , Patient Authorization Use Release Health Research Study Information ( HIPAA form ) . Be likely finish entire study , understand study instruction , willing follow instruction . Contact lens prescription +4.00 D 9.00 D ( spherical equivalent ) . Best correctable visual acuity least 20/40 eye . Willing deadapt ( wear ) habitual contact lenses period least two day prior eligibility visit least two day prior test day . Possess functional spectacle ( eyeglass ) prescription allow adequate vision deadaptation barrier function determination period . No known allergy , may interfere contact lens wear . No known systemic ( pertain general health ) disease , need medication may interfere contact lens wear ( i.e . antihistamine , betablockers , steroid ) . Less one month successful , full time ( define least 8 hour per day , 5 day per week ) soft lens wear . Clinically significant corneal swell ( great grade 3 4 04 scale ) , corneal blood vessel growth ( vascularization ) , corneal staining , bulbar redness , tarsal redness , abnormality cornea may cause unsafe contact lens wear . Any active ocular infection . Prior corneal refractive surgery ( i.e. , LASIK , PRK , etc ) . Have use medication within 24 hour study entry ongoing need use ocular medication .
